titleStmt.title: A scourge for George Whitehead. An apostate Quaker: an espouser of doctrines and practices tending to Romish-like bondage: a persecuting defamer of the real Christian-Quaker: a publick informer against William Pen, to his defamation: the author of a scandalous book, (written against my seventh part of the Christian-Quaker, &c.) stiled, judgment fixed, &c.
titleStmt.author: Rogers, William, d. ca. 1709.

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: W.R. (i.e. William Rogers).
Reproduction of the original in the Trinity College (University of Cambridge) Library.
